item.title: 马云回归，阿里巴巴重新聚焦
item.description: 欢迎收看《深度科技》（Tech In Depth），这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日通讯。今天，丁磊（Luz Ding）将介绍中国电子商务先驱如何在其标志性的联合创始人的帮助下稳住阵脚。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Luz Ding explains how China’s ecommerce pioneer has steadied the ship, with a hand from its iconic co-founder.】

item.title: 加拿大逆财政忧虑潮流而动，谋求更大赤字
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂（Chris Anstey），波士顿的经济编辑，今天我们将关注埃里克-赫茨伯格（Erik Hertzberg）在渥太华的报道。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston, and today we’re looking at Erik Hertzberg’s reporting from Ottawa. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 美国小型进口商正竭力弥补关税成本
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统及其支持者喜欢指出，迄今为止，美国消费者基本上没有受到贸易战的影响。但购物者通常是最后一个感受到影响的人，因为关税上调可能需要一年的时间才能在商店里表现为价格上涨。【原文：The American consumer has largely been unaffected so far by the trade war, as President Donald Trump and his backers like to note. But shoppers are usually the last ones to feel the effects since it can take a year for tariff increases to show up in stores as price hikes.】

item.title: 幼儿电视女王为何成为加沙活动家
item.description:
蕾切尔女士曾用低成本的教育视频迷倒了数百万儿童。现在，她进入了自己的 "宣传时代"。【原文：

Ms. Rachel has enchanted millions of kids with lo-fi, educational videos. Now she’s in her “advocacy era.”

】

item.title: 规模人工智能竞争对手 Invisible Technologies 估值超过 20 亿美元
item.description:
TPG旗下的瓦娜拉公司（Vanara）领投了最新一轮融资。【原文：

Vanara, a spinoff of TPG, led the latest funding round. 

】

item.title: 日本回击美国对俄罗斯石油加征关税的呼吁
item.description: 美国呼吁通过对中国和印度进口俄罗斯石油征收更高的关税，加大对普京总统施压的力度，迫使其结束乌克兰战争。【原文：Japan’s finance minister pushed back against a US call to ramp up pressure on President Vladimir Putin to end the war in Ukraine by imposing higher tariffs on China and India for importing Russian oil.】

item.title: 英国股票失宠，现在是逆向交易的首选
item.description: 投资者严重看跌英国股市，美国银行公司（Bank of America Corp.【原文：Investors are deeply bearish on UK stocks, with the Bank of America Corp. strategists calling the market one of the top contrarian trades.】

item.title: 香港禁入前花旗银行主管交易员海斯五年
item.description: 香港证券监察机构周二发表声明，禁止一名前花旗集团首席交易员在香港交易五年。【原文：Hong Kong’s securities watchdog banned a former Citigroup head trader for five years, according to a statement Tuesday.】

item.title: 鉴于市场反弹幅度之大，美联储的欣喜可能过头了
item.description:
摩根大通资产管理公司的凯利说，政治化的美联储将给市场增加一层风险。【原文：

JPMorgan Asset Management’s Kelly says a politicized Fed would add layer of risk to markets.

】

item.title: 特朗普全面改革美国经济后黑人失业率激增
item.description:
缩减联邦工作人员的努力正在加剧更广泛的经济放缓。【原文：

Efforts to shrink the federal workforce are supercharging a broader slowdown.

】

item.title: 从特朗普那里如愿以偿的首席执行官指南
item.description:
苹果、英特尔、Nvidia 和其他公司扭转了总统的反对态度，为他送上了丰厚的奖品和炫耀的权利。【原文：

Apple, Intel, Nvidia and other companies have reversed the president’s opposition by giving him a hefty prize, along with bragging rights.

】

item.title: 美联储 "第三授权 "迫使债券交易员反思陈旧规则
item.description: 对于华尔街的几代人来说，这是一个事实陈述：美联储的 "双重使命"--稳定物价和最大化就业--决定了其如何设定利率，从艾伦-格林斯潘到杰罗姆-鲍威尔，美联储一再援引这一使命。【原文：For generations on Wall Street, it was a statement of fact: The Federal Reserve’s “dual mandate” of price stability and maximum employment governed how it set interest rates, invoked time and again from Alan Greenspan to Jerome Powell.】

item.title: 收入最高的 10%人群在美国消费支出中所占份额不断增长
item.description: 富裕消费者在美国消费支出中所占的份额继续增长，这凸显了经济的片面强势，因为招聘放缓和其他收入群体的戒备心理引发了对经济放缓的担忧。【原文：Wealthy consumers continue to account for a growing share of US consumer spending, highlighting the lopsided strength of the economy as a slowdown in hiring and wariness among other income cohorts raise fears of a slowdown.】

item.title: 前华尔街交易员在土耳其股票调查中被拘留
item.description: 土耳其当局周二早些时候拘留了与涉嫌操纵股票的调查有关的 14 人，导致三家公司的股价跌至每日交易限额。据国营阿纳多卢通讯社（Anadolu Agency）报道，被拘留者中包括前华尔街交易员伊西克-奥克特（Isik Okte）。【原文：Turkish authorities detained 14 people early Tuesday in connection with an investigation into alleged stock manipulation, sending shares of three companies tumbling to their daily trading limits. Among those detained is former Wall Street trader Isik Okte, according to state-run Anadolu Agency.】

item.title: 泰国央行称黄金税是抑制泰铢涨势的选项之一
item.description: 泰国总理阿努廷-查维拉库（Anutin Charnvirakul）承诺 "紧急修复 "威胁泰国出口和旅游业的货币涨势，一天后，泰国央行表示，黄金税是正在考虑的抑制泰铢涨势的措施之一。【原文：Thailand’s central bank said a gold tax is among measures under consideration to temper the baht’s gains, a day after Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul pledged to “urgently fix” the currency rally threatening the nation’s exports and tourism.】

item.title: 意大利银行股因计划向贷款人融资 30 亿欧元而下挫
item.description: 据彭博社报道，意大利政府正在制定一项初步计划，通过推迟贷款人的税收减免，在未来两年内向贷款人筹集 30 亿欧元（35 亿美元）的资金，此后意大利银行股下跌。【原文：Italian bank stocks dropped after Bloomberg reported that Italy’s government is working on a preliminary plan to raise €3 billion ($3.5 billion) over the next two years from lenders by postponing their tax deductions.】

item.title: 估值焦虑从大型科技公司转移到 S&P 500 其他公司
item.description: 几个星期以来，人们越来越担心，S&P 500 指数不断创下新高，有可能成为泡沫。【原文：Worries have been mounting for weeks that the S&P 500’s push to record after record risks becoming a bubble, with the index’s swollen valuation cited most often as cause for concern.】

item.title: 加沙局势升级令投资者恐慌，以色列股市下跌
item.description: 随着以色列加强其在加沙的军事行动，以色列股市正走向五天连跌，这令希望结束战争的投资者感到恐慌。【原文：Israeli stocks are heading for a five-day losing streak as the country intensifies its military campaign in Gaza, spooking investors hoping for an end to the war.】

item.title: 美银美林的哈特内特认为，随着对增长的押注激增，股价涨势仍将延续
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的迈克尔-哈特内特（Michael Hartnett）认为，全球股市可能会进一步反弹，因为经济增长预期的跃升让股市多头牢牢掌控了局面。【原文：Global equities are likely to rally even higher as a jump in economic growth expectations is keeping stock bulls firmly in control, according to Bank of America Corp.’s Michael Hartnett.】

item.title: 菲律宾港口运营商 ICTSI 着眼于更多新兴市场交易
item.description: 国际集装箱码头服务公司（International Container Terminal Services, Inc.【原文：International Container Terminal Services, Inc. is pursuing further acquisitions in emerging economies, with the top Philippine port operator benefiting from a shift in trade flows triggered by the tariff war.】

item.title: 德国投资者情绪因出口希望而意外转好
item.description: 9 月份，投资者对德国经济前景的信心出乎意料地增强，这为欧洲最大经济体摆脱长期低迷带来了希望。【原文：Investor confidence in Germany’s economic prospects unexpectedly improved in September, supporting hopes that Europe’s largest economy is leaving behind a prolonged downturn.】

item.title: 如果摩根大通指数竞标成功，菲律宾将减少外国债券销售
item.description: 菲律宾财政部长莎伦-阿尔曼萨（Sharon Almanza）表示，如果菲律宾能被摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：The Philippines plans to reduce its foreign bond issuance next year if it wins inclusion in JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s flagship emerging-market debt index, Treasurer Sharon Almanza said.】

item.title: 乌克兰声称一夜之间袭击了俄罗斯萨拉托夫炼油厂
item.description: 在西方国家寻求将弗拉基米尔-普京总统推向谈判桌之际，乌克兰一夜之间袭击了俄罗斯伏尔加河地区的萨拉托夫原油炼油厂。【原文：Ukraine attacked the Saratov crude-oil refinery in Russia’s Volga region overnight as Western nations seek to push President Vladimir Putin to the negotiating table.】

item.title: 玻利维亚帕斯的最高经济顾问期待 40 亿美元的拯救计划
item.description: 玻利维亚中间派总统候选人罗德里戈-帕斯（Rodrigo Paz）的高级经济顾问表示，他计划在上任第一年向经济注入 40 亿美元，以促进经济增长和公共财政的健康发展。【原文：Bolivia’s centrist presidential hopeful Rodrigo Paz plans to inject $4 billion into the economy during his first year in office, according to his senior economic adviser, part of a bid to boost growth and promote healthier public finances.】

item.title: 人工智能成为战略关键，Trustpilot 上调利润率目标
item.description: Trustpilot Group Plc 提高了利润率指导，并推出了新的回购计划，因为这家客户点评公司将人工智能产品作为其战略的核心。【原文：Trustpilot Group Plc raised its margin guidance and launched a new buyback as the customer review company puts artificial intelligence products at the heart of its strategy.】

item.title: 英国购物者青睐超市品牌，食品通胀降温
item.description: 英国食品通胀率连续第二个月下降，报告显示购物者继续青睐超市的高端自有品牌产品。【原文：Food inflation cooled for a second month in the UK in a report that shows shoppers continued to favor supermarkets’ premium own-brand products.】

item.title: 国家养老金将上涨 4.7%，英国退休人员面临缴税问题
item.description: 在官方收入数据证实国家养老金将在明年 4 月上涨 4.7% 的通胀率后，英国的养老金领取者将从 2027 年开始为他们的国家退休金缴税。【原文：Britain’s pensioners are set to pay tax on their state retirement benefit from 2027 after official earnings data confirmed that the state pension will rise by an inflation-busting 4.7% next April.】

item.title: Janus 和贝莱德是失去荷兰信贷委托的管理公司之一
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：BlackRock Inc. is among a group of money managers to have lost credit mandates from one of Europe’s largest pension funds, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 医疗器械制造商明德瑞选择华泰和摩根大通在香港上市
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国最大的医疗设备制造商深圳明德生物医疗电子股份有限公司（Mindray Bio-Medical Electronics Co.【原文：China’s biggest maker of medical devices, Shenzhen Mindray Bio-Medical Electronics Co., has picked banks for its planned Hong Kong listing, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 据说阿曼化肥公司准备在马斯喀特上市
item.description: 阿曼印度化肥公司（Oman India Fertiliser Co SAOC）已开始为可能在马斯喀特上市做早期准备，这标志着阿曼苏丹国再次推动公司私有化并深化资本市场。【原文：Oman India Fertiliser Co SAOC has started early preparations for a potential listing in Muscat, marking a renewed push by the sultanate to privatize companies and deepen its capital markets.】
